1#![deny(rust_2018_idioms)]

3use std::{
4    borrow::{Borrow, Cow},
5    collections::HashSet,
6    fmt::{self, Write},
7};
8
9use pulldown_cmark::{Alignment as TableAlignment, Event, HeadingLevel, LinkType, MetadataBlockKind, Tag, TagEnd};
10
11/// Similar to [Pulldown-Cmark-Alignment][Alignment], but with required
12/// traits for comparison to allow testing.
13#[derive(Copy, Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
14pub enum Alignment {
15    None,
16    Left,
17    Center,
18    Right,
19}
20
21impl<'a> From<&'a TableAlignment> for Alignment {
22    fn from(s: &'a TableAlignment) -> Self {
23        match *s {
24            TableAlignment::None => Alignment::None,
25            TableAlignment::Left => Alignment::Left,
26            TableAlignment::Center => Alignment::Center,
27            TableAlignment::Right => Alignment::Right,
28        }
29    }
30}
31
32/// The state of the [`cmark_resume()`] and [`cmark_resume_with_options()`] functions.
33/// This does not only allow introspection, but enables the user
34/// to halt the serialization at any time, and resume it later.
35#[derive(Clone, Default, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
36pub struct State<'a> {
37    /// The amount of newlines to insert after `Event::Start(...)`
38    pub newlines_before_start: usize,
39    /// The lists and their types for which we have seen a `Event::Start(List(...))` tag
40    pub list_stack: Vec<Option<u64>>,
41    /// The computed padding and prefix to print after each newline.
42    /// This changes with the level of `BlockQuote` and `List` events.
43    pub padding: Vec<Cow<'a, str>>,
44    /// Keeps the current table alignments, if we are currently serializing a table.
45    pub table_alignments: Vec<Alignment>,
46    /// Keeps the current table headers, if we are currently serializing a table.
47    pub table_headers: Vec<String>,
48    /// The last seen text when serializing a header
49    pub text_for_header: Option<String>,
50    /// Is set while we are handling text in a code block
51    pub is_in_code_block: bool,
52    /// True if the last event was text and the text does not have trailing newline. Used to inject additional newlines before code block end fence.
53    pub last_was_text_without_trailing_newline: bool,
54    /// Currently open links
55    pub link_stack: Vec<LinkCategory<'a>>,
56    /// Currently open images
57    pub image_stack: Vec<ImageLink<'a>>,
58    /// Keeps track of the last seen heading's id, classes, and attributes
59    pub current_heading: Option<Heading<'a>>,
60
61    /// Keeps track of the last seen shortcut/link
62    pub current_shortcut_text: Option<String>,
63    /// A list of shortcuts seen so far for later emission
64    pub shortcuts: Vec<(String, String, String)>,
65}
66
67#[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
68pub enum LinkCategory<'a> {
69    AngleBracketed,
70    Shortcut { uri: Cow<'a, str>, title: Cow<'a, str> },
71    Other { uri: Cow<'a, str>, title: Cow<'a, str> },
72}
73
74#[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
75pub struct ImageLink<'a> {
76    uri: Cow<'a, str>,
77    title: Cow<'a, str>,
78}
79
80#[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
81pub struct Heading<'a> {
82    id: Option<Cow<'a, str>>,
83    classes: Vec<Cow<'a, str>>,
84    attributes: Vec<(Cow<'a, str>, Option<Cow<'a, str>>)>,
85}
86
87/// Thea mount of code-block tokens one needs to produce a valid fenced code-block.
88pub const DEFAULT_CODE_BLOCK_TOKEN_COUNT: usize = 3;
89
90/// Configuration for the [`cmark_with_options()`] and [`cmark_resume_with_options()`] functions.
91/// The defaults should provide decent spacing and most importantly, will
92/// provide a faithful rendering of your markdown document particularly when
93/// rendering it to HTML.
94///
95/// It's best used with its `Options::default()` implementation.
96#[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord, Hash)]
97pub struct Options<'a> {
98    pub newlines_after_headline: usize,
99    pub newlines_after_paragraph: usize,
100    pub newlines_after_codeblock: usize,
101    pub newlines_after_htmlblock: usize,
102    pub newlines_after_table: usize,
103    pub newlines_after_rule: usize,
104    pub newlines_after_list: usize,
105    pub newlines_after_blockquote: usize,
106    pub newlines_after_rest: usize,
107    /// The amount of newlines placed after TOML or YAML metadata blocks at the beginning of a document.
108    pub newlines_after_metadata: usize,
109    /// Token count for fenced code block. An appropriate value of this field can be decided by
110    /// [`calculate_code_block_token_count()`].
111    /// Note that the default value is `4` which allows for one level of nested code-blocks,
112    /// which is typically a safe value for common kinds of markdown documents.
113    pub code_block_token_count: usize,
114    pub code_block_token: char,
115    pub list_token: char,
116    pub ordered_list_token: char,
117    pub increment_ordered_list_bullets: bool,
118    pub emphasis_token: char,
119    pub strong_token: &'a str,
120}
121
122const DEFAULT_OPTIONS: Options<'_> = Options {
123    newlines_after_headline: 2,
124    newlines_after_paragraph: 2,
125    newlines_after_codeblock: 2,
126    newlines_after_htmlblock: 1,
127    newlines_after_table: 2,
128    newlines_after_rule: 2,
129    newlines_after_list: 2,
130    newlines_after_blockquote: 2,
131    newlines_after_rest: 1,
132    newlines_after_metadata: 1,
133    code_block_token_count: 4,
134    code_block_token: '`',
135    list_token: '*',
136    ordered_list_token: '.',
137    increment_ordered_list_bullets: false,
138    emphasis_token: '*',
139    strong_token: "**",
140};
141
142impl<'a> Default for Options<'a> {
143    fn default() -> Self {
144        DEFAULT_OPTIONS
145    }
146}
147
148impl<'a> Options<'a> {
149    pub fn special_characters(&self) -> Cow<'static, str> {
150        // These always need to be escaped, even if reconfigured.
151        const BASE: &str = "#\\_*<>`|[]";
152        if DEFAULT_OPTIONS.code_block_token == self.code_block_token
153            && DEFAULT_OPTIONS.list_token == self.list_token
154            && DEFAULT_OPTIONS.emphasis_token == self.emphasis_token
155            && DEFAULT_OPTIONS.strong_token == self.strong_token
156        {
157            BASE.into()
158        } else {
159            let mut s = String::from(BASE);
160            s.push(self.code_block_token);
161            s.push(self.list_token);
162            s.push(self.emphasis_token);
163            s.push_str(self.strong_token);
164            s.into()
165        }
166    }
167}
168
169/// Serialize a stream of [pulldown-cmark-Events][Event] into a string-backed buffer.
170///
171/// 1. **events**
172///    * An iterator over [`Events`][Event], for example as returned by the [`Parser`][pulldown_cmark::Parser]
173/// 1. **formatter**
174///    * A format writer, can be a `String`.
175/// 1. **state**
176///    * The optional initial state of the serialization.
177/// 1. **options**
178///    * Customize the appearance of the serialization. All otherwise magic values are contained
179///      here.
180///
181/// *Returns* the [`State`] of the serialization on success. You can use it as initial state in the
182/// next call if you are halting event serialization.
183/// *Errors* are only happening if the underlying buffer fails, which is unlikely.
184pub fn cmark_resume_with_options<'a, I, E, F>(
185    events: I,
186    mut formatter: F,
187    state: Option<State<'a>>,
188    options: Options<'_>,
189) -> Result<State<'a>, fmt::Error>
190where
191    I: Iterator<Item = E>,
192    E: Borrow<Event<'a>>,
193    F: fmt::Write,
194{
195    let mut state = state.unwrap_or_default();
196    fn padding<F>(f: &mut F, p: &[Cow<'_, str>]) -> fmt::Result
197    where
198        F: fmt::Write,
199    {
200        for padding in p {
201            write!(f, "{}", padding)?;
202        }
203        Ok(())
204    }
205    fn consume_newlines<F>(f: &mut F, s: &mut State<'_>) -> fmt::Result
206    where
207        F: fmt::Write,
208    {
209        while s.newlines_before_start != 0 {
210            s.newlines_before_start -= 1;
211            f.write_char('\n')?;
212            padding(f, &s.padding)?;
213        }
214        Ok(())
215    }
216
217    fn escape_leading_special_characters<'a>(
218        t: &'a str,
219        is_in_block_quote: bool,
220        options: &Options<'a>,
221    ) -> Cow<'a, str> {
222        if is_in_block_quote || t.is_empty() {
223            return Cow::Borrowed(t);
224        }
225
226        let first = t.chars().next().expect("at least one char");
227        if options.special_characters().contains(first) {
228            let mut s = String::with_capacity(t.len() + 1);
229            s.push('\\');
230            s.push(first);
231            s.push_str(&t[1..]);
232            Cow::Owned(s)
233        } else {
234            Cow::Borrowed(t)
235        }
236    }
237
238    fn print_text_without_trailing_newline<F>(t: &str, f: &mut F, p: &[Cow<'_, str>]) -> fmt::Result
239    where
240        F: fmt::Write,
241    {
242        if t.contains('\n') {
243            let line_count = t.split('\n').count();
244            for (tid, token) in t.split('\n').enumerate() {
245                f.write_str(token).and(if tid + 1 == line_count {
246                    Ok(())
247                } else {
248                    f.write_char('\n').and(padding(f, p))
249                })?;
250            }
251            Ok(())
252        } else {
253            f.write_str(t)
254        }
255    }
256
257    fn padding_of(l: Option<u64>) -> Cow<'static, str> {
258        match l {
259            None => "  ".into(),
260            Some(n) => format!("{}. ", n).chars().map(|_| ' ').collect::<String>().into(),
261        }
262    }
263
264    for event in events {
265        use pulldown_cmark::{CodeBlockKind, Event::*, Tag::*};
266
267        let event = event.borrow();
268
269        let last_was_text_without_trailing_newline = state.last_was_text_without_trailing_newline;
270        state.last_was_text_without_trailing_newline = false;
271        match *event {
272            Rule => {
273                consume_newlines(&mut formatter, &mut state)?;
274                if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_rule {
275                    state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_rule;
276                }
277                formatter.write_str("---")
278            }
279            Code(ref text) => {
280                if let Some(shortcut_text) = state.current_shortcut_text.as_mut() {
281                    shortcut_text.push('`');
282                    shortcut_text.push_str(text);
283                    shortcut_text.push('`');
284                }
285                if let Some(text_for_header) = state.text_for_header.as_mut() {
286                    text_for_header.push('`');
287                    text_for_header.push_str(text);
288                    text_for_header.push('`');
289                }
290                if text.chars().all(|ch| ch == ' ') {
291                    write!(formatter, "`{text}`")
292                } else {
293                    let backticks = "`".repeat(count_consecutive(text, '`') + 1);
294                    let space = match text.as_bytes() {
295                        &[b'`', ..] | &[.., b'`'] => " ", // Space needed to separate backtick.
296                        &[b' ', .., b' '] => " ",         // Space needed to escape inner space.
297                        _ => "",                          // No space needed.
298                    };
299                    write!(formatter, "{backticks}{space}{text}{space}{backticks}")
300                }
301            }
302            Start(ref tag) => {
303                if let List(ref list_type) = *tag {
304                    state.list_stack.push(*list_type);
305                    if state.list_stack.len() > 1 && state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_rest {
306                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_rest;
307                    }
308                }
309                let consumed_newlines = state.newlines_before_start != 0;
310                consume_newlines(&mut formatter, &mut state)?;
311                match tag {
312                    Item => match state.list_stack.last_mut() {
313                        Some(inner) => {
314                            state.padding.push(padding_of(*inner));
315                            match inner {
316                                Some(n) => {
317                                    let bullet_number = *n;
318                                    if options.increment_ordered_list_bullets {
319                                        *n += 1;
320                                    }
321                                    write!(formatter, "{}{} ", bullet_number, options.ordered_list_token)
322                                }
323                                None => write!(formatter, "{} ", options.list_token),
324                            }
325                        }
326                        None => Ok(()),
327                    },
328                    Table(ref alignments) => {
329                        state.table_alignments = alignments.iter().map(From::from).collect();
330                        Ok(())
331                    }
332                    TableHead => Ok(()),
333                    TableRow => Ok(()),
334                    TableCell => {
335                        state.text_for_header = Some(String::new());
336                        formatter.write_char('|')
337                    }
338                    Link {
339                        link_type,
340                        dest_url,
341                        title,
342                        id: _,
343                    } => {
344                        state.link_stack.push(match link_type {
345                            LinkType::Autolink | LinkType::Email => {
346                                formatter.write_char('<')?;
347                                LinkCategory::AngleBracketed
348                            }
349                            LinkType::Shortcut => {
350                                state.current_shortcut_text = Some(String::new());
351                                formatter.write_char('[')?;
352                                LinkCategory::Shortcut {
353                                    uri: dest_url.clone().into(),
354                                    title: title.clone().into(),
355                                }
356                            }
357                            _ => {
358                                formatter.write_char('[')?;
359                                LinkCategory::Other {
360                                    uri: dest_url.clone().into(),
361                                    title: title.clone().into(),
362                                }
363                            }
364                        });
365                        Ok(())
366                    }
367                    Image {
368                        link_type: _,
369                        dest_url,
370                        title,
371                        id: _,
372                    } => {
373                        state.image_stack.push(ImageLink {
374                            uri: dest_url.clone().into(),
375                            title: title.clone().into(),
376                        });
377                        formatter.write_str("![")
378                    }
379                    Emphasis => formatter.write_char(options.emphasis_token),
380                    Strong => formatter.write_str(options.strong_token),
381                    FootnoteDefinition(ref name) => {
382                        state.padding.push("    ".into());
383                        write!(formatter, "[^{}]: ", name)
384                    }
385                    Paragraph => Ok(()),
386                    Heading {
387                        level,
388                        id,
389                        classes,
390                        attrs,
391                    } => {
392                        assert_eq!(state.current_heading, None);
393                        state.current_heading = Some(self::Heading {
394                            id: id.as_ref().map(|id| id.clone().into()),
395                            classes: classes.iter().map(|class| class.clone().into()).collect(),
396                            attributes: attrs
397                                .iter()
398                                .map(|(k, v)| (k.clone().into(), v.as_ref().map(|val| val.clone().into())))
399                                .collect(),
400                        });
401                        match level {
402                            HeadingLevel::H1 => formatter.write_str("#"),
403                            HeadingLevel::H2 => formatter.write_str("##"),
404                            HeadingLevel::H3 => formatter.write_str("###"),
405                            HeadingLevel::H4 => formatter.write_str("####"),
406                            HeadingLevel::H5 => formatter.write_str("#####"),
407                            HeadingLevel::H6 => formatter.write_str("######"),
408                        }?;
409                        formatter.write_char(' ')
410                    }
411                    BlockQuote => {
412                        state.padding.push(" > ".into());
413                        state.newlines_before_start = 1;
414
415                        // if we consumed some newlines, we know that we can just write out the next
416                        // level in our blockquote. This should work regardless if we have other
417                        // padding or if we're in a list
418                        if consumed_newlines {
419                            formatter.write_str(" > ")
420                        } else {
421                            formatter.write_char('\n').and(padding(&mut formatter, &state.padding))
422                        }
423                    }
424                    CodeBlock(CodeBlockKind::Indented) => {
425                        state.is_in_code_block = true;
426                        for _ in 0..options.code_block_token_count {
427                            formatter.write_char(options.code_block_token)?;
428                        }
429                        formatter.write_char('\n').and(padding(&mut formatter, &state.padding))
430                    }
431                    CodeBlock(CodeBlockKind::Fenced(ref info)) => {
432                        state.is_in_code_block = true;
433                        let s = if !consumed_newlines {
434                            formatter
435                                .write_char('\n')
436                                .and_then(|_| padding(&mut formatter, &state.padding))
437                        } else {
438                            Ok(())
439                        };
440
441                        s.and_then(|_| {
442                            for _ in 0..options.code_block_token_count {
443                                formatter.write_char(options.code_block_token)?;
444                            }
445                            Ok(())
446                        })
447                        .and_then(|_| formatter.write_str(info))
448                        .and_then(|_| formatter.write_char('\n'))
449                        .and_then(|_| padding(&mut formatter, &state.padding))
450                    }
451                    HtmlBlock => Ok(()),
452                    MetadataBlock(MetadataBlockKind::YamlStyle) => formatter.write_str("---\n"),
453                    MetadataBlock(MetadataBlockKind::PlusesStyle) => formatter.write_str("+++\n"),
454                    List(_) => Ok(()),
455                    Strikethrough => formatter.write_str("~~"),
456                }
457            }
458            End(ref tag) => match tag {
459                TagEnd::Link => match state.link_stack.pop().unwrap() {
460                    LinkCategory::AngleBracketed => formatter.write_char('>'),
461                    LinkCategory::Shortcut { uri, title } => {
462                        if let Some(shortcut_text) = state.current_shortcut_text.take() {
463                            state
464                                .shortcuts
465                                .push((shortcut_text, uri.to_string(), title.to_string()));
466                        }
467                        formatter.write_char(']')
468                    }
469                    LinkCategory::Other { uri, title } => close_link(&uri, &title, &mut formatter, LinkType::Inline),
470                },
471                TagEnd::Image => {
472                    let ImageLink { uri, title } = state.image_stack.pop().unwrap();
473                    close_link(uri.as_ref(), title.as_ref(), &mut formatter, LinkType::Inline)
474                }
475                TagEnd::Emphasis => formatter.write_char(options.emphasis_token),
476                TagEnd::Strong => formatter.write_str(options.strong_token),
477                TagEnd::Heading(_) => {
478                    let self::Heading {
479                        id,
480                        classes,
481                        attributes,
482                    } = state.current_heading.take().unwrap();
483                    let emit_braces = id.is_some() || !classes.is_empty() || !attributes.is_empty();
484                    if emit_braces {
485                        formatter.write_str(" {")?;
486                    }
487                    if let Some(id_str) = id {
488                        formatter.write_char(' ')?;
489                        formatter.write_char('#')?;
490                        formatter.write_str(&id_str)?;
491                    }
492                    for class in classes.iter() {
493                        formatter.write_char(' ')?;
494                        formatter.write_char('.')?;
495                        formatter.write_str(class)?;
496                    }
497                    for (key, val) in attributes.iter() {
498                        formatter.write_char(' ')?;
499                        formatter.write_str(key)?;
500                        if let Some(val) = val {
501                            formatter.write_char('=')?;
502                            formatter.write_str(val)?;
503                        }
504                    }
505                    if emit_braces {
506                        formatter.write_char(' ')?;
507                        formatter.write_char('}')?;
508                    }
509                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_headline {
510                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_headline;
511                    }
512                    Ok(())
513                }
514                TagEnd::Paragraph => {
515                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_paragraph {
516                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_paragraph;
517                    }
518                    Ok(())
519                }
520                TagEnd::CodeBlock => {
521                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_codeblock {
522                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_codeblock;
523                    }
524                    state.is_in_code_block = false;
525                    if last_was_text_without_trailing_newline {
526                        formatter.write_char('\n')?;
527                    }
528                    for _ in 0..options.code_block_token_count {
529                        formatter.write_char(options.code_block_token)?;
530                    }
531                    Ok(())
532                }
533                TagEnd::HtmlBlock => {
534                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_htmlblock {
535                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_htmlblock;
536                    }
537                    Ok(())
538                }
539                TagEnd::MetadataBlock(MetadataBlockKind::PlusesStyle) => {
540                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_metadata {
541                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_metadata;
542                    }
543                    formatter.write_str("+++\n")
544                }
545                TagEnd::MetadataBlock(MetadataBlockKind::YamlStyle) => {
546                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_metadata {
547                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_metadata;
548                    }
549                    formatter.write_str("---\n")
550                }
551                TagEnd::Table => {
552                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_table {
553                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_table;
554                    }
555                    state.table_alignments.clear();
556                    state.table_headers.clear();
557                    Ok(())
558                }
559                TagEnd::TableCell => {
560                    state.table_headers.push(
561                        state
562                            .text_for_header
563                            .take()
564                            .filter(|s| !s.is_empty())
565                            .unwrap_or_else(|| "  ".into()),
566                    );
567                    Ok(())
568                }
569                ref t @ TagEnd::TableRow | ref t @ TagEnd::TableHead => {
570                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_rest {
571                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_rest;
572                    }
573                    formatter.write_char('|')?;
574
575                    if let TagEnd::TableHead = t {
576                        formatter
577                            .write_char('\n')
578                            .and(padding(&mut formatter, &state.padding))?;
579                        for (alignment, name) in state.table_alignments.iter().zip(state.table_headers.iter()) {
580                            formatter.write_char('|')?;
581                            // NOTE: For perfect counting, count grapheme clusters.
582                            // The reason this is not done is to avoid the dependency.
583                            let last_minus_one = name.chars().count().saturating_sub(1);
584                            for c in 0..name.len() {
585                                formatter.write_char(
586                                    if (c == 0 && (alignment == &Alignment::Center || alignment == &Alignment::Left))
587                                        || (c == last_minus_one
588                                            && (alignment == &Alignment::Center || alignment == &Alignment::Right))
589                                    {
590                                        ':'
591                                    } else {
592                                        '-'
593                                    },
594                                )?;
595                            }
596                        }
597                        formatter.write_char('|')?;
598                    }
599                    Ok(())
600                }
601                TagEnd::Item => {
602                    state.padding.pop();
603                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_rest {
604                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_rest;
605                    }
606                    Ok(())
607                }
608                TagEnd::List(_) => {
609                    state.list_stack.pop();
610                    if state.list_stack.is_empty() && state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_list {
611                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_list;
612                    }
613                    Ok(())
614                }
615                TagEnd::BlockQuote => {
616                    state.padding.pop();
617
618                    if state.newlines_before_start < options.newlines_after_blockquote {
619                        state.newlines_before_start = options.newlines_after_blockquote;
620                    }
621
622                    Ok(())
623                }
624                TagEnd::FootnoteDefinition => {
625                    state.padding.pop();
626                    Ok(())
627                }
628                TagEnd::Strikethrough => formatter.write_str("~~"),
629            },
630            HardBreak => formatter.write_str("  \n").and(padding(&mut formatter, &state.padding)),
631            SoftBreak => formatter.write_char('\n').and(padding(&mut formatter, &state.padding)),
632            Text(ref text) => {
633                if let Some(shortcut_text) = state.current_shortcut_text.as_mut() {
634                    shortcut_text.push_str(text);
635                }
636                if let Some(text_for_header) = state.text_for_header.as_mut() {
637                    text_for_header.push_str(text)
638                }
639                consume_newlines(&mut formatter, &mut state)?;
640                state.last_was_text_without_trailing_newline = !text.ends_with('\n');
641                print_text_without_trailing_newline(
642                    &escape_leading_special_characters(text, state.is_in_code_block, &options),
643                    &mut formatter,
644                    &state.padding,
645                )
646            }
647            InlineHtml(ref text) => {
648                consume_newlines(&mut formatter, &mut state)?;
649                print_text_without_trailing_newline(text, &mut formatter, &state.padding)
650            }
651            Html(ref text) => {
652                let mut lines = text.split('\n');
653                if let Some(line) = lines.next() {
654                    formatter.write_str(line)?;
655                }
656                for line in lines {
657                    formatter.write_char('\n')?;
658                    padding(&mut formatter, &state.padding)?;
659                    formatter.write_str(line)?;
660                }
661                Ok(())
662            }
663            FootnoteReference(ref name) => write!(formatter, "[^{}]", name),
664            TaskListMarker(checked) => {
665                let check = if checked { "x" } else { " " };
666                write!(formatter, "[{}] ", check)
667            }
668        }?
669    }
670    Ok(state)
671}
672
673/// As [`cmark_resume_with_options()`], but with default [`Options`].
674pub fn cmark_resume<'a, I, E, F>(events: I, formatter: F, state: Option<State<'a>>) -> Result<State<'a>, fmt::Error>
675where
676    I: Iterator<Item = E>,
677    E: Borrow<Event<'a>>,
678    F: fmt::Write,
679{
680    cmark_resume_with_options(events, formatter, state, Options::default())
681}
682
683fn close_link<F>(uri: &str, title: &str, f: &mut F, link_type: LinkType) -> fmt::Result
684where
685    F: fmt::Write,
686{
687    let separator = match link_type {
688        LinkType::Shortcut => ": ",
689        _ => "(",
690    };
691
692    if uri.contains(' ') {
693        write!(f, "]{}<{uri}>", separator, uri = uri)?;
694    } else {
695        write!(f, "]{}{uri}", separator, uri = uri)?;
696    }
697    if !title.is_empty() {
698        write!(f, " \"{title}\"", title = EscapeLinkTitle(title))?;
699    }
700    if link_type != LinkType::Shortcut {
701        f.write_char(')')?;
702    }
703
704    Ok(())
705}
706
707struct EscapeLinkTitle<'a>(&'a str);
708
709/// Writes a link title with double quotes escaped.
710/// See https://spec.commonmark.org/0.30/#link-title for the rules around
711/// link titles and the characters they may contain.
712impl fmt::Display for EscapeLinkTitle<'_> {
713    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {
714        for c in self.0.chars() {
715            match c {
716                '"' => f.write_str(r#"\""#)?,
717                '\\' => f.write_str(r"\\")?,
718                c => f.write_char(c)?,
719            }
720        }
721        Ok(())
722    }
723}
724
725impl<'a> State<'a> {
726    pub fn finalize<F>(mut self, mut formatter: F) -> Result<Self, fmt::Error>
727    where
728        F: fmt::Write,
729    {
730        if self.shortcuts.is_empty() {
731            return Ok(self);
732        }
733
734        formatter.write_str("\n")?;
735        let mut written_shortcuts = HashSet::new();
736        for shortcut in self.shortcuts.drain(..) {
737            if written_shortcuts.contains(&shortcut) {
738                continue;
739            }
740            write!(formatter, "\n[{}", shortcut.0)?;
741            close_link(&shortcut.1, &shortcut.2, &mut formatter, LinkType::Shortcut)?;
742            written_shortcuts.insert(shortcut);
743        }
744        Ok(self)
745    }
746}
747
748/// As [`cmark_resume_with_options()`], but with the [`State`] finalized.
749pub fn cmark_with_options<'a, I, E, F>(
750    events: I,
751    mut formatter: F,
752    options: Options<'_>,
753) -> Result<State<'a>, fmt::Error>
754where
755    I: Iterator<Item = E>,
756    E: Borrow<Event<'a>>,
757    F: fmt::Write,
758{
759    let state = cmark_resume_with_options(events, &mut formatter, Default::default(), options)?;
760    state.finalize(formatter)
761}
762
763/// As [`cmark_with_options()`], but with default [`Options`].
764pub fn cmark<'a, I, E, F>(events: I, mut formatter: F) -> Result<State<'a>, fmt::Error>
765where
766    I: Iterator<Item = E>,
767    E: Borrow<Event<'a>>,
768    F: fmt::Write,
769{
770    cmark_with_options(events, &mut formatter, Default::default())
771}
772
773/// Return the `<seen amount of consecutive fenced code-block tokens> + 1` that occur *within* a
774/// fenced code-block `events`.
775///
776/// Use this function to obtain the correct value for `code_block_token_count` field of [`Options`]
777/// to assure that the enclosing code-blocks remain functional as such.
778///
779/// Returns `None` if `events` didn't include any code-block, or the code-block didn't contain
780/// a nested block. In that case, the correct amount of fenced code-block tokens is
781/// [`DEFAULT_CODE_BLOCK_TOKEN_COUNT`].
782///
783/// ```rust
784/// use pulldown_cmark::Event;
785/// use pulldown_cmark_to_cmark::*;
786///
787/// let events = &[Event::Text("text".into())];
788/// let code_block_token_count = calculate_code_block_token_count(events).unwrap_or(DEFAULT_CODE_BLOCK_TOKEN_COUNT);
789/// let options = Options {
790///     code_block_token_count,
791///     ..Default::default()
792/// };
793/// let mut buf = String::new();
794/// cmark_with_options(events.iter(), &mut buf, options);
795/// ```
796pub fn calculate_code_block_token_count<'a, I, E>(events: I) -> Option<usize>
797where
798    I: IntoIterator<Item = E>,
799    E: Borrow<Event<'a>>,
800{
801    let mut in_codeblock = false;
802    let mut max_token_count = 0;
803
804    // token_count should be taken over Text events
805    // because a continuous text may be splitted to some Text events.
806    let mut token_count = 0;
807    let mut prev_token_char = None;
808    for event in events {
809        match event.borrow() {
810            Event::Start(Tag::CodeBlock(_)) => {
811                in_codeblock = true;
812            }
813            Event::End(TagEnd::CodeBlock) => {
814                in_codeblock = false;
815                prev_token_char = None;
816            }
817            Event::Text(x) if in_codeblock => {
818                for c in x.chars() {
819                    let prev_token = prev_token_char.take();
820                    if c == '`' || c == '~' {
821                        prev_token_char = Some(c);
822                        if Some(c) == prev_token {
823                            token_count += 1;
824                        } else {
825                            max_token_count = max_token_count.max(token_count);
826                            token_count = 1;
827                        }
828                    }
829                }
830            }
831            _ => prev_token_char = None,
832        }
833    }
834
835    max_token_count = max_token_count.max(token_count);
836    (max_token_count >= 3).then_some(max_token_count + 1)
837}
838
839fn count_consecutive(text: &str, search: char) -> usize {
840    let mut in_tokens = false;
841    let mut max_backticks = 0;
842    let mut cur_tokens = 0;
843
844    for ch in text.chars() {
845        if ch == search {
846            cur_tokens += 1;
847            in_tokens = true;
848        } else if in_tokens {
849            max_backticks = max_backticks.max(cur_tokens);
850            cur_tokens = 0;
851            in_tokens = false;
852        }
853    }
854    max_backticks.max(cur_tokens)
855}
856
857#[cfg(test)]
858mod count_consecutive {
859    use super::count_consecutive;
860
861    #[test]
862    fn happens_in_the_entire_string() {
863        assert_eq!(
864            count_consecutive("``a```b``", '`'),
865            3,
866            "the highest seen consecutive segment of backticks counts"
867        );
868        assert_eq!(count_consecutive("```a``b`", '`'), 3, "it can't be downgraded later");
869    }
870}
